description: Borrowed from Latin aureatus (“adorned or decorated with gold”).

adjectives.description: aureate (comparative more aureate, superlative most aureate)

examples: O wynd of grace, now blowe into my saile, / O auriat lycour of Clyo, for to wryte / Mi penne enspire of that I wold endyte.

entries.meaning: (rhetoric) Of language: characterized by the use of (excessively) ornamental or grandiose terms, often of Latin or French origin.
